summary: This is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, dated January 28, 2020. The emails discuss a media report on coverage from the previous day and request a comparison chart between announcements related to Michael Avenatti and Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Michael Avenatti
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject for a requested comparison chart of media announcements, alongside Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as a subject for a requested comparison chart of media announcements, alongside Michael Avenatti.

connections.description: Both are subjects of media announcements that the U.S. Attorney's Office is asked to compare in a chart.

events.title: Media coverage referenced in report
events.description: A media report covers the previous day's news coverage, the specific content of which is not detailed in this email.

events.title: Internal request for comparison chart
events.description: A U.S. Attorney's Office staff member requests a chart comparing media announcements related to Michael Avenatti and Jeffrey Epstein.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated January 28, 2020.
It references a media report on coverage from January 27, 2020.
A specific request is made to create a chart comparing media announcements related to Michael Avenatti and Jeffrey Epstein.
The email chain shows internal coordination within the U.S. Department of Justice's Public Affairs/Press Office regarding media coverage of high-profile cases.
